image.altText: Linda Reynolds speaks at a doorstop as the PM Scott Morrison stands behind her grinning

props.synopsis: The former prime minister denounces what he labels the "weaponising" of Brittany Higgins's rape allegation by Labor, saying it left his then-defence minister in such a distressed state he was concerned it could be fatal for her.

title.children: Scott Morrison says Linda Reynolds' 'lying cow' comment was 'out of character'

image.altText: Balconies on a hotel apartment building

props.synopsis: The team will review Canberra building designs before construction begins and attend inspections alongside private certifiers to reduce the prevalence of defects in high-rise buildings.

title.children: ACT government team to oversee building certifiers to reduce high-rise defects

props.synopsis: Police say there were people in a 24-hour gym upstairs from the barber shop when it was set alight and it was lucky nobody was injured or killed. Â

title.children: Alleged arsonist accidentally sets himself alight during barber shop break-in

image.altText: A medium sized dog with white fluffy hair sits, with a woman behind her.

props.synopsis: Animal rescue organisations say they are struggling to cope amid a surge in pet surrenders, with RSPCA ACT saying they are seeing a 30 to 40 per cent increase from last year.

title.children: Designer dogs among pets being abandoned as rescue organisations swamped by unwanted animals

image.altText: Two AFP cars and an officer outside Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The union representing Australian Federal Police officers warns that officers will abandon their posts at Parliament House later this week if their pay demands are not met.

title.children: 'We stop terrorists': AFP officers threaten to walk off the job at Parliament House amid pay dispute

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a teenage school girl leaning against the lockers on her phone.

props.synopsis: A plan for venues, such as pubs and hotels, to verify someone's identity through a QR code will be unveiled today by Bill Shorten. Follow live.Â

title.children: Plan to allow Aussies to use QR codes to verify ID

image.altText: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi points at a reporter

title.children: As Pelosi attacks Keatingâs Taiwan comments, she says she would have hit Trump at US Capitol on January 6

image.altText: Generic picture of Australian bank notes

props.synopsis: The annual pace of wage growth has remained steady in the June quarter, at 4.1 per cent, with an increase in public sector wage growth offsetting a decline in private sector wages.

title.children: Annual wage growth remains at 4.1 per cent in June quarter

image.altText: charred helicopter wreckage lifted from hotel roof

props.synopsis: Investigators continue to probe what happened before the allegedly stolen craft crashed.

title.children: Recording devices from helicopter that crashed into Cairns hotel roof sent for analysis as investigation turns to pilot

image.altText: Ukrainian servicemen sit on tops of a military vehicle, realxing with one eating a packet of chips.

props.synopsis: Since launching a surprise attack last week, Moscow has been unable to push Ukrainian troops back after they advanced up to 30km into Russian territory and are now in control of about 28 settlements. Â

title.children: Ukraine launched a surprise attack, now Russian territory is under occupation for the first time since WWII

image.altText: Jordan Chiles posing with a gold and bronze Olympic medal from the Paris Games

props.synopsis: USA Gymnastics officials have said an arbitration panel will not reconsider a decision asking gymnast Jordan Chiles to return the bronze medal she was awarded in the floor exercise at the Paris Olympics.

title.children: CAS reportedly will not consider allowing US gymnast to keep bronze medal won by Romanian

image.altText: A flag that says CFMEU flying at a construction site.

props.synopsis: A construction industry insider who alleges he was physically struck by a CFMEU member has accused union officials of acting like "the meanest bully you've ever come across."

title.children: 'Enough is enough': Construction insider relates CFMEU 'bully' tactics

image.altText: A photo of a man in a lab.

props.synopsis: More than two dozen lab tests have been unable to diagnose long COVID, according to new research which suggests there may be no reliable way to diagnose the condition.

title.children: There is no single test to diagnose long COVID patients, international researchers say

props.synopsis: The site showed that the page was "not available" shortly after the scheduled start for some users.

title.children: Elon Musk claims 'massive DDOS attack' on X during Donald Trump interview

image.altText: Outside of building.

props.synopsis: The company that operates a northern Gold Coast childcare centre has faced court after two young children walked out a gate and along a busy road in 2022.

title.children: Childcare centre fined after two young toddlers escaped through open gate

image.altText: Beau Lamarre in a police uniform

title.children: Former police officer accused of murdering Sydney couple has charges replaced

image.altText: A man and woman stand on a stage

title.children: To beat Trump, Harris will likely need this small state. Here's how she and Walz are faring in Wisconsin

image.altText: A woman, holds her mouth open, and shows off her teeth after dental work.

props.synopsis: An Indian dental clinic which markets cut-price services to Australians has been accused of using fake online reviews and price gouging â leaving one woman in pain after she travelled to the subcontinent for care.

title.children: The Australian woman in 'constant pain' after travelling to India for cheaper dental work

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab and long dress stands next to a window in a corridor with her hand on the window sill

props.synopsis: People from southern Lebanon have had to flee the daily air strikes on their villages, and for months have stayed in derelict hotels-turned-shelters.

title.children: Displaced Lebanese beg to go home as country braces for worse fighting

image.altText: Front of large building with glass doors

props.synopsis:
Handing down her findings, the NSW Deputy State Coroner praises the police officers involved in a fatal shooting while urging Corrective Services to enhance rehabilitation for high-risk offenders.

title.children: Coroner finds police response was 'beyond textbook' in fatal shooting of man in southern NSW

image.altText: Sinead Diver pictured in action at the Tokyo Olympics

image.altText: A hand holding a microphone. Foam on top of the microphone has '7 News' on it.

props.synopsis: Four Corners has spoken to more than 200 people to investigate allegations of Channel Seven's toxic culture, uncovering allegations of bullying, sexism, and exploitation.

title.children: 'This was a tool, a tactic': When Channel 7 staff complained, management had HR turn on them

image.altText: Albanese walks and looks serious on the lower house floor.

props.synopsis: Laws to restrict gambling advertising are being bargained over inside Labor's caucus, as the prime minister warns a misstep could have "unintended consequences" for Australia.

title.children: Government bargains to win over Labor MPs on laws to ban gambling ads around children's programs and live sport

image.altText: A marle statue of three headless female figures, standing nude, side by side, with arms on one another.

props.synopsis: From the influence of the devil to overzealous restorers, there are numerous strange reasons and theories behind the conspicuous lack of pubic hair on women depicted in Western art.

title.children: The nude female body has been depicted in art countless times. But where is all the pubic hair?

image.altText: Crowd of people on the streets of Sydney

props.synopsis: Whatever way you try to split it, the generational divide between millennials and baby boomers is growing â and it's our Australian obsession with owning property that is widening the gap, and interest rates that are keeping it that way.

title.children: The great wealth shuffle. Why millennials are missing out

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Wage price growth has remained steady at 4.1 per cent over the year to June while the Australian share market is trading flat. Follow the day's events and insights as they happenÂ withÂ our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.Â

image.altText: An aeriel shot of a space rover/lander on Mars.

props.synopsis: Mars may have enough water hiding in the cracks of underground rocks to form a global ocean, new research suggests. The lead scientist on the project says it means some environments could possibly be habitable on the Red Planet.Â

title.children: An ocean's worth of water may be hiding beneath the red dusty surface of Mars

image.altText: NSW Premier Chris Minns speaks to media during a press conference in Sydney

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns banned full-day retail trade on the national day of remembrance, with the exemption of "essential" service providers including hotels and clubs.

title.children: NSW premier argues gambling is 'long tradition' as Anzac Day pokies ban debated

image.altText: A young man with a beard poses for a portrait inside, looking into camera with a serious facial expression.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has uncovered a probe into nepotism allegations against a senior executive of the Queensland Public Trustee whose son was employed and promoted by the agency.

title.children: 'I was ropeable': Worker missed out on promotion in favour of Public Trustee executive's son

image.altText: A male splendid fairywren stands in dappled light with a sunbeam lighting its head.

props.synopsis: They may seem like just a beautiful blue bird, but under the surface the social dynamics of the splendid fairy-wren is anything but simple.

title.children: 'Like watching a soap opera': The splendid social life of Australiaâs bluest bird

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin celebrates after beating Andrey Rublev

props.synopsis: Australia's Alexei Popyrin has continued his incredible giant-killing run in Montreal by thrashing Russia's Andrey Rublev to claim the first Masters 1000 title of his career.

title.children: 'It means the world': Alexei Popyrin thrashes Russian star Andrey Rublev in Canadian Open final to end 21-year drought

image.altText: Two people enjoy movie with drinks and popcorn.

props.synopsis: There are fewer theatres to visit in the country these days, but operators say they are still pulling in punters.

title.children: Cinemas still popular as $12 beers become the norm in cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: a beach with a rocky cove in the foreground

props.synopsis: Huge swells move tonnes of sand from the northern end of the eastern suburbs beach, but the new feature will only be there for a couple of months according to lifeguards.

title.children: Freshly uncovered cove at Sydney beach attracts visitors, human and seal, but comes with a warning
